segments.text: I see the woman, completely engrossed in drying that plate, as if the world around her has faded away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Part of me envies her focus, her calm in the midst of chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I’m jolted back to reality by the water flooding the floor beneath her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I try to call out to her silently, urging her to notice the growing puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her obliviousness frustrates me; how can she not feel the cold water at her feet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the boy, my goodness, he looks like he’s about to topple off that stool!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He seems so confident, so daring, and I can't help but admire that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl with her hand raised is just precious, waiting for her cookie like it’s gold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, I can’t shake this sense of impending doom looming over them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Is anyone else seeing what I see?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The serene garden outside offers such a false sense of security; it’s maddening!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a scene from a comedy, only it might end in disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every moment feels stretched, as if time is waiting to see what happens next.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could warn them, but I know they’re in their own world.
segments.speaker: PAR
